content.description: Start as for Mercury Fold but climb straight up the technical blunt arete using a series of sidepulls and slopers to gain the top.
Start matched in the cool granite hueco. A mantle move leads to better holds up high.
content.location: From the clearing, follow the cliffband to the right.

content.description: Start left hand on an undercling and right hand on a lower good edge. Climb up through a cool granite hueco to thinning holds and a delicate top. Each move is more difficult than the last!
content.location: Middle of the cliffband seen from the clearing.

content.description: Start left hand on a nice jug edge and right hand on a side pull. After a large first move to the shelf, head up the obvious side pulls and a long reach to the lip.
content.location: From the clearing, follow the cliffband to the left.

content.description: Jump start to good ledge, get a high foot and tech your way up the seam, reach out right to a good edge on the face and topout.
content.location: Straight up the face between Real Magic and Balducci Levatation.

content.description: Start on a good low jug to the left. Traverse the long overhanging crack to a jug. Top out. Probably not too difficult, but will require more cleaning and I have yet to see it fully dry.
content.location: From the clearing, follow the cliffband to the left.

content.description: SDS with right hand side pull and left hand crimp on prominent rail. Bump up to obvious jug and right hand crimp. Make a dynamic move to jug near the top. Tricky top out.
content.location: From the clearing, follow cliff band left just past I Like Jugs and Cannot Lie

content.description: Stand start with good left hand side pull on the arete and low right hand undercling on the face. Trend upwards and to the right arete using tricky moves and cool slopers. Top out.
content.location: From the clearing, follow the cliffband to the right and up a small gulley. This boulder is easily seen from below

content.description: Start on left hand low jug, right hand high jug. Match before making long reach to high jug and topping out. Possible harder variation starting with right hand on a low crimp in SDS.
content.location: From clearing, follow cliffband to the left. This problem is directly left of I Cannot Lie.

content.description: Start on a hard sit start and climb crack to top out on some jugs. Crux is the crack just before the jugs and top out.
content.location: Half way between Real Magic and Psychic Surgery.

content.description: Stand start on the large edge and climb the aesthetic arete.
content.location: From the clearing, follow the cliffband to the left.

content.description: Along the Granite Path trail is an outcropping which hosts several great problems. Most are highball.
